Based on my search results, I found some information about Polish translations of "Brave New World" (Nowy wspaniały świat), but unfortunately, the search results don't contain specific details about the differences between the translations by Bogusław Zieliński and Aneta Górnicka-Bolek.

From the search results, I can tell you that:

The most commonly mentioned translator of "Brave New World" into Polish is Bogdan Baran, whose translation appears in recent editions from publishers like Muza (published in 2022).

The novel "Brave New World" by Aldous Huxley was written in 1931 and published in 1932, and the first Polish edition was published in 1933.

The Polish title is "Nowy wspaniały świat" and it's classified as a dystopian science fiction novel.
